notes.text: Affected versions of the module provide insufficient protection from packet capture replay. This could allow unauthorized remote attackers to bypass authentication and access the application.CVE-2022-37011 has been assigned to this vulnerability. A CVSS v3 base score of 7.4 has been calculated; the CVSS vector string is (AV:N/AC:H/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:H/I:H/A:N).
notes.title: Vulnerability Summary

remediations.details: Siemens and Mendix recommend users update to the latest versions of the respective devices:
For applications upgraded to Mendix 9 from earlier Mendix versions, the issue has already been resolved in V3.3.0.
For compatibility reasons, fixed versions still contain this issue, but only when the not recommended, non-default configuration option ‘Allow Idp Initiated Authentication’ is enabled.

As a general security measure, Siemens recommends protecting network access to devices with appropriate mechanisms. To operate the devices in a protected IT environment, Siemens recommends configuring the environment according to Siemens’ operational guidelines for industrial security and following recommendations in the product manuals.
Additional information on industrial security by Siemens can be found on the Siemens industrial security webpage.
For more information see SSA-638652 in HTML or CSAF formats.

Additional mitigation guidance and recommended practices are publicly available on the ICS webpage at cisa.gov/ics in the technical information paper, ICS-TIP-12-146-01B--Targeted Cyber Intrusion Detection and Mitigation Strategies.
